Key Match Events: The LA Lakers outscored the Toronto Raptors 97-69 in the next three quarters to get the decisive win.
Anthony Davis sustained his dominance in the paint in the second quarter.
LeBron James recorded his second straight triple-double with 19 points, 16 assists, and 10 rebounds.
Post-Match Reflections: The Toronto Raptors gave a good fight, but playing on short rest and without key players proved too much to overcome.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The LA Lakers shook off a sluggish first half and Anthony Davis' eye injury to beat the Toronto Raptors 123-103 on Sunday.
Anthony Davis suffered an eye injury and did not return after exiting with 5:16 remaining in the third quarter.
Others: The Raptors were ready for the Lakers to open the game and led 34-26 after one quarter.
RJ Barrett, Gradey Dick, and Jakob Poeltl led the visitors in scoring.
Cam Reddish, Austin Reaves, LeBron James, and D'Angelo Russell picked up the scoring slack in the third quarter.
